biolockj.util

Class BioLockJUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.util.BioLockJUtil

  • public class BioLockJUtil
extends Object
    Simple utility containing String manipulation and formatting functions.

    • Field Detail

      • INTERNAL_PIPELINE_INPUT_TYPES

        public static final String INTERNAL_PIPELINE_INPUT_TYPES
        Internal Config String property: "internal.pipelineInputTypes"
        This value is set after parsing the input files from Config property: "input.dirPaths" in the method: getPipelineInputFiles(). The primary purpose of storing this value is to determine if BioModule.getPreRequisiteModules() are appropriate to add during pipeline initialization.

        BioModule.getPreRequisiteModules() are add dependent modules if missing from the Config. This ensures the current module will have the correct input files and is a convenient way to manage the size and readability of Config files. Prerequisite modules are always appropriate for full pipelines with sequence input file, however if the output from a prerequisite module is used as the input for a new pipeline via "input.dirPaths", adding the prerequisite module will cause FATAL pipeline errors.

        New pipelines can be run starting with any module, so BioLockJ must be prepared to accept the input files required for any module. All BioModules require input files from one of the following 6 categories:
        • "otu_count"
        • "classifier_output"
        • "R"
        • "seq"
        • "stats"
        • "taxa_count"
        In rare cases, such as running R plot modules, the input directories must contain multiple data types.
        For example:
        • "otu_count"
        • "R"
        • "stats"
        With this input a user can run a pipeline with only 2 modules:
        1. JsonReport
        2. R_PlotOtus
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PIPELINE_R_INPUT_TYPE

        public static final String PIPELINE_R_INPUT_TYPE
        Internal Config String property: "R"
        Set as the value of "internal.pipelineInputTypes" if input files are some type of count table merged with the metadata such as those output by AddMetadataToTaxaTables. These files can be input into any R_Module.
        See Also:

        public static String formatDigits(Integer input,
                                  Integer numDigits)

        Simply add leading zeros until numDigits is reached.
        Parameters:

        numDigits - Number of digits return value should contain
        Returns:
        number as String with leading zeros.

      • parseCountTable

        public static List<List<String>> parseCountTable(File file)
                                          throws Exception
        Read in BioLockJ count table, each inner lists represents 1 line from the file.
        Each cell in the tab delimited file is stored as 1 element in the inner lists.
        Parameters:
        file - Path abundance file
        Returns:
        List of Lists - each inner list 1 line
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

        Returns:
